content.question: Let <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the vector-valued function defined by <math alttext="g of t, equals, open angled bracket, 2 times cosine t, comma, 4 times sine t, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is <math alttext="g prime of open parenthesis, pi over 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction with numerator 2, and denominator the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2, and denominator the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, the negative of the square root of 3, comma 2, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, the square root of 3, comma 2, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open angled bracket, the negative of the square root of 3, comma 2, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.4: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
